result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Sertle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.
  • Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.
  • Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2 & 3 and any existing sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. $1040.00 Drug Buy Reimbursement Money to be Joint/Several with Michael Chmiel.  The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with co-defendant-Michael Chmiel.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2 & 3 and any existing sentence.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:06 am case called. Defendant Justin J. Sertle in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Defendant Justin J. Sertle in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.   Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause, and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Goldin confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1, Count 2, & Count 3.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 4 & 5 and dismisses outright second and subsequent enhancer on Counts 1, 2, & 3.  Court questions parties regarding PSI-Defendant does not wish to have a PSI completed. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Goldin. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: EACH COUNT- 6 years and 9 months Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 33 months Initial Confinement and 48 months Extended Supervision. Concurrent to each other and concurrent to any existing sentence. No Credit for time served. CONDITIONS OF ES: $1040 Buy Money-joint/several with co-defendant-Michael Chmiel. Costs to be paid through DOC authorization and balance during extended supervision. No Contact with Co-defendant-Michael Chmiel,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Maintain full-time employment. Terms of Agent.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court finds defendant eligible for CIP & SAP. Appeal Rights Given.

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:34 p.m. Defendant in court with attorney Matthew Goldin. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court withdraws the warrant previously issued.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. DA Blader requesting $5000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Goldin. Court orders $5000 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
